## Classes Index

<MembersIndex>

<MembersIndexItem
  type="class"
  name={<><a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/sys/dynamiclibrary">DynamicLibrary</a></>}>
This class provides a portable interface to dynamic libraries which also might be known as shared libraries, shared objects, dynamic shared objects, or dynamic link libraries. <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/sys/dynamiclibrary/#details">More...</a>
</MembersIndexItem>

</MembersIndex>

<Link id="l00023" /><CodeLine lineNumber="23"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00024" /><CodeLine lineNumber="24"><Highlight kind="comment">/// This class provides a portable interface to dynamic libraries which also</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00025" /><CodeLine lineNumber="25"><Highlight kind="comment">/// might be known as shared libraries, shared objects, dynamic shared</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00026" /><CodeLine lineNumber="26"><Highlight kind="comment">/// objects, or dynamic link libraries. Regardless of the terminology or the</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00027" /><CodeLine lineNumber="27"><Highlight kind="comment">/// operating system interface, this class provides a portable interface that</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00028" /><CodeLine lineNumber="28"><Highlight kind="comment">/// allows dynamic libraries to be loaded and searched for externally</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00029" /><CodeLine lineNumber="29"><Highlight kind="comment">/// defined symbols. This is typically used to provide &quot;plug-in&quot; support.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00030" /><CodeLine lineNumber="30"><Highlight kind="comment">/// It also allows for symbols to be defined which don&#39;t live in any library,</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00031" /><CodeLine lineNumber="31"><Highlight kind="comment">/// but rather the main program itself, useful on Windows where the main</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00032" /><CodeLine lineNumber="32"><Highlight kind="comment">/// executable cannot be searched.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00033" /><CodeLine lineNumber="33" lineLink="/docs/api/classes/llvm/sys/dynamiclibrary"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">class </Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"><a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/sys/dynamiclibrary/#a57f3eea5ad36a6b82ec5bb2b63363227">DynamicLibrary</a> &#123;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00034" /><CodeLine lineNumber="34"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Placeholder whose address represents an invalid library.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00035" /><CodeLine lineNumber="35"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// We use this instead of NULL or a pointer-int pair because the OS library</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00036" /><CodeLine lineNumber="36"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// might define 0 or 1 to be &quot;special&quot; handles, such as &quot;search all&quot;.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00037" /><CodeLine lineNumber="37"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">static</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">char</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#af59335be18fa802d111a646be658b7d0a68a576ae5bab85b26f5e5a947d3b41e8">Invalid</a>;</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00051" /><CodeLine lineNumber="51"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// Searches through the library for the symbol \\p symbolName. If it is</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00052" /><CodeLine lineNumber="52"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// found, the address of that symbol is returned. If not, NULL is returned.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00053" /><CodeLine lineNumber="53"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// Note that NULL will also be returned if the library failed to load.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00054" /><CodeLine lineNumber="54"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// Use isValid() to distinguish these cases if it is important.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00055" /><CodeLine lineNumber="55"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// Note that this will \\e not search symbols explicitly registered by</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00056" /><CodeLine lineNumber="56"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// AddSymbol().</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00058" /><CodeLine lineNumber="58"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00059" /><CodeLine lineNumber="59"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// This function permanently loads the dynamic library at the given path</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00060" /><CodeLine lineNumber="60"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// using the library load operation from the host operating system. The</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00061" /><CodeLine lineNumber="61"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// library instance will only be closed when global destructors run, and</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00062" /><CodeLine lineNumber="62"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// there is no guarantee when the library will be unloaded.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00063" /><CodeLine lineNumber="63"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00066" /><CodeLine lineNumber="66"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// the library fails to load.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00067" /><CodeLine lineNumber="67"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00068" /><CodeLine lineNumber="68"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// It is safe to call this function multiple times for the same library.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00069" /><CodeLine lineNumber="69"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// Open a dynamic library permanently.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00122" /><CodeLine lineNumber="122"><Highlight kind="comment">    /// SO&#95;LoadOrder - Or this in to search libraries in the ordered loaded.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00123" /><CodeLine lineNumber="123"><Highlight kind="comment">    /// The default bahaviour is to search loaded libraries in reverse.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00124" /><CodeLine lineNumber="124" lineLink="/docs/api/classes/llvm/sys/dynamiclibrary/#a5e198e8003db7c5e9f35ee98a5897e59a766335f02cb77f4bea92f2212f65c0b5"><Highlight kind="normal">    <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/sys/dynamiclibrary/#a5e198e8003db7c5e9f35ee98a5897e59a766335f02cb77f4bea92f2212f65c0b5">SO&#95;LoadOrder</a> = 4</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00125" /><CodeLine lineNumber="125"><Highlight kind="normal">  &#125;;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00126" /><CodeLine lineNumber="126" lineLink="/docs/api/classes/llvm/sys/dynamiclibrary/#a796ad78100654a505c1803a39208fb5d"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">static</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/sys/dynamiclibrary/#a5e198e8003db7c5e9f35ee98a5897e59">SearchOrdering</a> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/sys/dynamiclibrary/#a796ad78100654a505c1803a39208fb5d">SearchOrder</a>; </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// = SO&#95;Linker</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00127" /><CodeLine lineNumber="127"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00128" /><CodeLine lineNumber="128"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// This function will search through all previously loaded dynamic</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00129" /><CodeLine lineNumber="129"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// libraries for the symbol \\p symbolName. If it is found, the address of</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00130" /><CodeLine lineNumber="130"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// that symbol is returned. If not, null is returned. Note that this will</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00131" /><CodeLine lineNumber="131"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// search permanently loaded libraries (getPermanentLibrary()) as well</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00132" /><CodeLine lineNumber="132"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// as explicitly registered symbols (AddSymbol()).</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00133" /><CodeLine lineNumber="133"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// @throws std::string on error.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00134" /><CodeLine lineNumber="134"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// Search through libraries for address of a symbol</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00135" /><CodeLine lineNumber="135"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">static</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">void</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> &#42;<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/sys/dynamiclibrary/#ae003d16a33e81b88943d3e3aa179fcc4">SearchForAddressOfSymbol</a>(</Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">const</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">char</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> &#42;symbolName);</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00136" /><CodeLine lineNumber="136"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00137" /><CodeLine lineNumber="137"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// Convenience function for C++ophiles.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00138" /><CodeLine lineNumber="138" lineLink="/docs/api/classes/llvm/sys/dynamiclibrary/#a5d4956a5c03696b5bb8230f61deb8061"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">static</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">void</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> &#42;<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/sys/dynamiclibrary/#a5d4956a5c03696b5bb8230f61deb8061">SearchForAddressOfSymbol</a>(</Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">const</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> std::string &amp;symbolName) &#123;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00139" /><CodeLine lineNumber="139"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">return</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/sys/dynamiclibrary/#ae003d16a33e81b88943d3e3aa179fcc4">SearchForAddressOfSymbol</a>(symbolName.c&#95;str());</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00140" /><CodeLine lineNumber="140"><Highlight kind="normal">  &#125;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00141" /><CodeLine lineNumber="141"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00142" /><CodeLine lineNumber="142"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// This functions permanently adds the symbol \\p symbolName with the</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00143" /><CodeLine lineNumber="143"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// value \\p symbolValue.  These symbols are searched before any</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00144" /><CodeLine lineNumber="144"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// libraries.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00145" /><CodeLine lineNumber="145"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// Add searchable symbol/value pair.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00146" /><CodeLine lineNumber="146"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">static</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">void</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/sys/dynamiclibrary/#a2f997f2beb9cf206cd215663be3b9617">AddSymbol</a>(<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/stringref">StringRef</a> symbolName, </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">void</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> &#42;symbolValue);</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00147" /><CodeLine lineNumber="147"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00148" /><CodeLine lineNumber="148"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">class </Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">HandleSet;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00149" /><CodeLine lineNumber="149"><Highlight kind="normal">&#125;;</Highlight></CodeLine>
